intro: Balsamophloeos kataf, commonly known as the African balsamwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Balsamophloeos kataf is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
